summary: The document is a declassified record released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, dated March 5, 1969. It details the case of an individual with a history of mental instability and fabrication, leading to the revocation of their clearances in June 1961. The individual had previously served in Japan in April 1958 and was relieved of duties with the 441st CIC Detachment. Additionally, the document references a request for confirmation traces on the subject, potentially connected to an approach to the American Consulate General in Zurich in June 1968.
key_findings: The document pertains to an individual with mental instability and a history of fabrication.
Clearances were revoked in June 1961 due to mental instability.
The individual served in Japan in April 1958 and was relieved of duties with the 441st CIC Detachment.
A request for confirmation traces on the subject is mentioned, possibly linked to an approach to the American Consulate General in Zurich in June 1968.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
